channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report X-2023080498
item.description:
Report X-2023080498

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-28
  • City: COVINGTON
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hypochlorite solution ( Detergent bottle). found in unload DescribePack: Loose cap, internal leaking DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Placed inside hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023080492
item.description:
Report X-2023080492

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-24T18:13:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-27
  • City: COVINGTON
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came off trailer from OLIV with side wall wet. Inspection reveal internal leakage. DescribePack: The seal underneath the cap corroded from the liquid causing it to leak past the cap. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined damaged hazmat tote and relocated to hazmat cage. No spillage found in trailer or on dock.

item.title: Report E-2023080169
item.description:

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-08
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into one of the metal 55 gallon drums of araldire (un3082) releasing 5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
